title: Hypothesis Testing Framework
contentHtml:
In statistics, hypothesis testing is a crucial framework for making inferences about populations based on samples. The core idea is to formulate a null hypothesis and an alternative hypothesis.

The null hypothesis (H0) represents the status quo or what we expect to happen, while the alternative hypothesis (H1) represents what we're interested in discovering.
name: Null and Alternative Hypotheses" },
intuition: The framework helps us separate chance fluctuations from real effects, allowing us to draw conclusions about the world.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, hypothesis testing is used in model evaluation and selection.
commonMistakes: Failing to specify a clear null and alternative hypothesis

subject: statistics
title: Hypothesis Testing Framework
contentHtml:
In statistics, hypothesis testing is a framework used to determine whether a given phenomenon or effect exists in a population based on data from a sample.

The core idea is to formulate a null hypothesis (usually denoted as H0) and an alternative hypothesis (denoted as H1). The null hypothesis typically states that there is no significant difference or relationship, while the alternative hypothesis suggests that there is a significant difference or relationship.
name: Null and Alternative Hypotheses
intuition: This framework matters because it provides a systematic approach to testing hypotheses, which is crucial in many fields like medicine, social sciences, and business.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, hypothesis testing is used to evaluate the performance of different models and determine whether they are significantly better than others.
commonMistakes: Failing to specify a clear null and alternative hypothesis
